byline.original: By J. DAVID GOODMAN and WILLIAM NEUMAN

abstract: New York City Mayor Bill de Blasio announces $82.2 billion executive budget centered on savings plucked from city agencies, along with several new programs; budget embraces quality-of-life improvements rather than ambitious policy goals.
lead_paragraph: The mayor’s $82.2 billion plan includes roughly $1 billion in savings and additional money to improve city agencies with recent problems, like the elections board.

headline.main: De Blasio Unveils New York Budget Focused on Savings and Fixes
headline.print_headline: De Blasio Unveils a Budget  Aimed at Fixes and Savings

snippet: The mayor’s $82.2 billion plan includes roughly $1 billion in savings and additional money to improve city agencies with recent problems, like the elections board.
